page.title: 09AVON WILDLIFE RESERVE
page.content: The Avon Wildlife Trust was formed in 1980 in Bristol and is a voluntary organisation with three full-time workers. It is their aim to preserve and develop areas that will provide protection for the plants and animals that grow and live in Avon. One such area is south of St.Thomas's Head skirting the estuary of the River Banwell. This small reserve provides a haven for migrating birds and others such as the Gold Crest, Fire Crest, Kestrel and on one rare occasion a Merlin was sighted. There is a badger set on the reserve and many rabbits . The natural plant life benefits from the closed nature of the reserve and amongst many species are two types of orchid and a rare Somerset grass.
